features.feature: Calculate Payment Schedule with Rule Engine Scheduling

features.evidence: CalculatePaymentSchedule: The purpose of this transformation is to create a Payment Schedule for Dental Claim. Transformation is invoked in the *calculatePaymentSchedule* command Execute phase. Creates the request for OpenL rules. Invokes Payment Scheduler OpenL rules. Creates *CapDentalPaymentScheduleEntity* and maps rule results to *CapDentalPaymentScheduleEntity.payments*.

features.feature: Manage Payment Template Lifecycle Transitions

features.feature: Activate Payment Schedule with Authority Level Validation
features.source_document: GRC_Claim/Claim/Accident and Health (Claim)/Health (Claim) (AH)/Dental Product (Claim) (AH Dental)/Dental Financials Models (Claim)/Dental Payment Schedule Model (Claim)/Dental Payment Schedule Life Cycle Transitions (Claim)/BR_Dental Claim Payment Schedule Activation (Claim).md
features.evidence: BR>Dental Claim Payment Schedule Activation: Get highest user authority level with AuthorityLevelType = 'cap' and AuthorityLevelSubType = Dental. Get total allocations amount = Sum of all allocations gross amount. Get authority level limit status. IF authority level limit status = 'Review' THEN add error and automatically generate task. IF any critical message is generated then activation status = 'Review' ELSE 'Activate'.

features.feature: Manage Payment Schedule State Transitions

If Payment Schedule status is Suspend, system will not issue the single payments. If Payee's Preferred Payment Method is not Check/EFT or does not exist, system will update the single payments status to Cancelled.

features.feature: Validate Payment Template Data Before Scheduling

features.feature: Cancel Payment Schedule and Associated Payments

Before generating a new schedule the system searches for any existing payment schedules in state 'Active', 'Suspended' or 'Open' within the same payment level and deactivates them.

If there are any payments created, but not yet issued, these must be canceled. The system searches for any existing payments in 'Approved' state within the provided payment level and cancel them with message code 'BuildPaymentScheduleFlow-CancelActivePayments'.

Invalid: Process ends if settlement proposal is not 'Pay' or 'PREDET-APPROVE' and settlement state is not 'Approved'.
